workDescription: Build custom analytics dashboard where users can create their own reports with drag-and-drop widgets, filters, and data visualizations.

context.userProblem: Power users want custom analytics views. Current dashboard is fixed layout. Users export to spreadsheets to create their own charts.
context.businessValue: Differentiation feature for enterprise tier. Justify 2x price increase. Retain power users.
context.currentState: Fixed dashboard with 6 pre-built reports. No customization.

rabbitHoles: Responsive layout on different screen sizes
noGos: Don't build a full BI tool (stick to core metrics)
Don't add new data sources yet
Don't rebuild the entire analytics backend

shapingNotes.whyShapingOnly: This example focuses on the SHAPING phase. Shows how to shape complex UI work. May not get bet on first cycle - might need to simplify appetite.
keyShapingDecisions: Which widgets to include in v1

affordances: Drag widget from library to canvas

fatMarkerSketches: Dashboard builder with canvas and widget library

strengths: Power users willing to pay more
concerns: Might need 2 cycles to do well
bettingConsiderations.likelyOutcome: Needs more shaping or should be reshaped as graduated approach (basic customization first, advanced features later)

notes: This example shows SHAPING PHASE in detail
Demonstrates complex UI feature with many rabbit holes
Good example of work that might not get bet on first try
Shows importance of calling out complexity during shaping
Illustrates competing priorities at betting table
Might be better as 2-3 smaller bets with graduated commitment
